Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.text: Hang out our banners on the outward walls. The cry is still 'They come!'

Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.text: Our castle’s strength will laugh a siege to scorn. Were they not forced with those that should be ours, we might have met them dareful, beard to beard, and beat them backward home.
Act5Scene5.translation: Our castle's is enough to laugh off their seige. If so many of our soldiers hadn't betrayed us and joined them, we would met in front of the castle and battled man to man, and sent them back to England.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Seyton
Act5Scene5.text: It is the cry of women, my good lord.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.text: I have almost forgot the taste of fears.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.text: I have supped full with horrors. Direness, familiar to my slaughterous thoughts, cannot once start me.
Act5Scene5.translation: I have feasted on true horrors so much now that it has become it has become familiar to my bloody thoughts that it can no longer startle me.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Seyton
Act5Scene5.text: The Queen, my lord, is dead.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.translation: She was going to die anyways.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.text: Thou com’st to use thy tongue: thy story quickly.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Messenger
Act5Scene5.text: Gracious my lord, I should report that which I say I saw, but know not how to do ’t.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Messenger
Act5Scene5.text: As I did stand my watch upon the hill, I looked toward Birnam, and anon methought the Wood began to move.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Messenger
Act5Scene5.text: Let me endure your wrath if ’t be not so. Within this three mile may you see it coming. I say, a moving grove.

Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.text: If thou speak’st false, upon the next tree shall thou hang alive till famine cling thee. —Arm, arm, and out!— —Ring the alarum bell!—

Act5Scene5.speaker: Macbeth
Act5Scene5.text: At least we’ll die with harness on our back.
Act5Scene5.translation: At least we'll die with armor on our backs.
